abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Mine Closure,
            Environmental and Socio-Economic Regeneration Project for
            Romania were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was moderate; Bank
            performance was satisfactory and borrower performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            It is important to consult and involve the community in the
            mine closure process. Before and during the mine closure
            process, meetings were held regularly with the neighboring
            communities both to keep them informed and to solicit
            feedback and inputs. Support socio-economic regeneration
            schemes that actively engage the community as a whole and
            help bring people together. The success of socioeconomic
            regeneration beyond the life of the project depends to a
            great extent on the local communities' involvement and
            endorsement. Bureaucratic procedures that are functioning
            reasonably well should not be changed in the middle of
            project implementation. Delegate and empower field
            supervision to ensure a consistent level of quality
            throughout the implementation phases. Mine closure project
            duration should take into consideration the complexity of
            the types of included mines.
